title: X-Mas Keen memories? Do tell.
content:
Hi, I thought that this kind of thing would be nice in this month's issue of CKN.
So, have you got Keen for X-Mas when you were younger? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-christmas.gif[/img] Could you tell about it. What Keen it was, how old you were, what it felt like, had you wished it and so on. Everything you can remember. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Also, try to check you don't make so much typing errors, that I don't need to try to fix them.
GO!"For years they studied, collected, catalogued. When they had learned all that they could, they began to modify." 3001: The final Odyssey

title: Re: X-Mas Keen memories? Do tell.
content:
I believe I got Keen 1 for my birthday which was in january, so that's pretty close after Christmas. Anyway I returned another game for Keen 1.-----------------
Sinterklaas and Djaser hate Santa Claus!!!!

title: Re: X-Mas Keen memories? Do tell.
content: i wanted the gameboy colour version of it, but i had to order from sydney cos i couldn't find it anywhere[img]http://www.freewebs.com/jawawars/keengamer.txt[/img]

title: Re: X-Mas Keen memories? Do tell.
content:
I never got any Keen games for Christmas... though the first time I could play the games (all but Keen5) on my own computer may have well have been Christmas.

And the time I got Keen5 was as good as it as well... I mean, what would you do if you could wish for anything you wanted and have it granted instantly? Keen5, of course! And then... more wishes... and then the whole thing gets taken out of proportion... be careful what you wish for.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-shikadi.gif[/img]

I'll leave you with that, though... there's much more to the story than can be told in one post...

Most of my Christmases from 1996 (when I got Klik & Play) onward have been laced with game development and such, which certainly helps motivate my endeavours throughout the rest of the year, when it tends to feel quite apart from Christmas indeed.

>Commander SpleenCave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

"To stop your eyes from watering when chopping onions, put them in the freezer for 10 minutes beforehand."
- Reader's Digest

JimSoft Lair Updated
http://jimsoftlair.tripod.com/

title: Re: X-Mas Keen memories? Do tell.
content: Christmas day...  I open my presents, and what do my eyes see?  Commander Keen 6:  Aliens Ate My Babysitter!  That's right, I got it for Christmas.  I eagerly popped that bad boy into my computer, loaded it up, put in the password, and went at it.  I played a few levels, and then I got to the top of one of the levels and I was preplexed to find Molly my Babysiter there.  I would have thought the game was longer than that...  So I got her and I then found out that they hadn't sent me the full version!!  They sent me the demo!  I eventually got the full one from the company that sent it to us and played to my hearts content.

title: um
content: Molly was never in the demo, so how, how did you see her?

title: Re: um
content: Really?  I could have sworn that she was in the demo...  All the way at the top of the bloogton manfacturing behind a door that you needed a key for.  Huh...  strange...  I'd look, but the floppy disk that had it got corrupted like all old floppies.  Sigh, Keen Dreams also got corrupted [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

title: Re: um
content: Hmmm, I remember not seeing her there as well. But try to get some screens if you find it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Who knows, maybe it's some rare demo version."For years they studied, collected, catalogued. When they had learned all that they could, they began to modify." 3001: The final Odyssey

title: Re: um
content:
I'm pretty sure when you got to the end of the last level in the demo, Keen mentions that you've get the full version and save Molly. Maybe that's what you were thinking of, perhaps.

Anyway, I got the Vorticons trilogy for Christmas in 1993, after getting Keen I with my 386 a year or two earlier. I'd never paid much attention to Keen before getting that (the trilogy).

title: Re: um
content:
Keen 1-3 and 4 for christmas when I was a wee young one. Couple years later I got Keen 6 demo, Keen Dreams, Jill of the Jungle episode 1, and the rescue rover demo. Later I purchased keen 5 and 6 full version.

title: Re: um
content: Oh, man, the only reason I'm into Keen right now is Christmas. I went to my cousin's house for christmas at age 5, and saw my cousin playing Keen 4. She game overed on the isle of tar, and let me play. I loved it, and I nearly peed my pants I was so scared of the Dopefish. XD Then, next year, I got 4 and 5 for Christmas. Played them to death on my Grandpa's computer.<img Src=http://pages.sprint.ca/LVKomix/files/avatar2.jpg>
